recipe.title: How to Make Fairy Bread
recipe.intro: Fairy bread is a classic Australian kids' party food. It is white bread with butter and colourful sprinkles. So simple, but everyone loves it!
recipe.ingredients: white bread, butter, rainbow sprinkles (hundreds and thousands)
steps: **Spread** a thick layer of butter on each slice.
**Pour** the rainbow sprinkles onto a plate.
**Press** the buttered side of the bread into the sprinkles.
**Arrange** the fairy bread on a big plate and **serve** at the party!

review.text: I visited Esplanade Bites with my niece on Saturday. She wanted fairy bread, and they had it on the kids' menu! The bread was fresh and soft. The sprinkles were bright and colourful. My niece was so happy. I also ordered a flat white coffee. The cafÃ© is right next to the Esplanade lagoon, so we could watch people swimming. A fun place for families!

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: Hello! Welcome to our cafÃ©. What can I get for you?

lines.speaker: Sophie
lines.text: Hi! I am having a birthday party for my daughter. Do you sell fairy bread?

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: Yes, we do! How many pieces would you like?

lines.speaker: Sophie
lines.text: Can I get twenty pieces, please? Cut into triangles?

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: Of course! We cut them into triangles. Would you like anything else?

lines.speaker: Sophie
lines.text: Do you also have a kids' juice box?

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: Yes, we have apple and orange juice boxes.

lines.speaker: Sophie
lines.text: Great, ten apple juice boxes, please.

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: Sure! That will be forty-five dollars altogether.

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: Yes, tap or insert is fine. Here is the machine. Thank you!

quiz3.explanation_correct: æ­£è§£ï¼"Can I get twenty pieces, please?"

part_a.full_text: Are you ready for the party? Almost! I need to make the fairy bread. Do you have the sprinkles? Yes, they are in the cupboard. Great. I already spread butter on all the bread. Now I just need to press the bread into the sprinkles. How many slices did you make? I made twenty slices. That should be enough for ten kids. Perfect. Let me help you cut them into triangles.

gaps.before: Let me help you cut them into

part_b.full_text: Excuse me, I am looking for rainbow sprinkles. Do you have them? Yes, we do. They are in aisle three, next to the baking supplies. We have two sizes: a small jar for four dollars and a big jar for seven dollars. The big jar is very popular for parties. We also have chocolate sprinkles if you like. They are on the same shelf. If you need white bread, it is in aisle one. Is there anything else I can help you with?

try_it.example: When I was a child, I loved rainbow candy. My mum always bought it for my birthday party. I was so happy when I saw the colourful sweets on the table!
